q: Certain software is being developed using the waterfall model. The programming code is being tested currently using the grey box method. Between what two phases of the model is the software lodged?
The following is the hypothetical data pertaining to the COCOMO type of software development. The LOC is 500. What is the time taken for this project?

An organization is carrying out multiple products using various SDLC models. Given are the problems that have risen in various projects. Which of the following shortcomings are a result of using the prototype model?

Options

  1. No user-testable or working version of the software model is made available until the last phase.
  2. Software is designed and developed preliminarily unaware of user requirements.
  3. The team does not develop a conclusive plan for risk management and has fixed requirements.
  4. Developer uses an inefficient or inappropriate algorithm as they are unaware of the real goal.
While developing a webpage, the model you choose to develop the required software necessitates the purchase of hardware in the early stages of designing the software. What model have you adopted?
You are developing a simple data processing system using the Constructive Cost Model. What system type of COCOMO will you use?

Most of the RUP guidance is published in HTML form. Why is this the case?

Options

  1. It allows easy platform-independent access.
  2. It creates ready-to-use user templates.
  3. It provides tools that cover the entire life-cycle.
  4. It enables a structured creation of information.
You are testing the software you developed, and want to determine the size of the software. What will be your preferred metric?
X is a RUP-Product tool that helps develop automated development of software documentation. What is X?

You are developing a web application using the iterative model. The following represent the analysis and design at different stages.
Design(0), Analysis(0), Design(1), Analysis(1), Design(2), Analysis(2)
Which option accurately represents the flow of the software?

Options

1.

Design(0)->Analysis(1)
Design(1)->
Analysis(2)

2.

Design(1)->Analysis(0)
Design(2)->
Analysis(1)

3.

Analysis(0)->Design(1)
Analysis(1)->Design(2)

4.

Analysis(0)->Design(0)
Analysis(1)->Design(1)

Miscommunication between your business and software engineering team is a common occurrence in your organization, this has led to the lack of sync between inputs and outputs from both teams. You have recently adopted the Rational Unified Process. How does this RUP help resolve this matter?

Options

  1. RUP offers new components and remodels existing components to make the two models work in synchronization and are easy to maintain.
  2. RUP utilized a common language of communication between the teams, ensuring a direct link between the two models. 
  3. RUP provides structured packages and sub-systems with well-defined interfaces that allow a smooth transition between the models. 
  4. RUP suggests an iterative process and automated testing that allows fluid interaction between the two models.

The money transfer application you develop makes use of the following cause-effect table. What must the state of C1, C2, and C3 for A3 be executed?

Options

1.

C1-T
C2-T
C3-F

2.

C1-T
C2-F
C3-T

3.

C1-F
C2-Nil
C3-Nil

4.

C1-F
C2-T
C3-F

A certain function in your code has a list with 3 elements, a check box, a language box with two language options, and a text box that accepts only integer inputs that are two digits long between 1 and 50. This results in 600 possible combinations. How do you decrease the total number of combinations to be tested?

The following code is a part of your application:

public class WebsiteEntryAge{
public static void main(String[]args){
int n = 20
if(n>=12)
{
    System.out.printIn(“Access Granted”);
} else
{
    System.out.printIn(“Access Denied”);
}
}
}

If you were to create a control flow graph of this, what would be classified as the decision node?

A snippet of code in the program for software is found to use variables that were not declared previously. What happens while executing the program?

Options

  1. All of the code except the erroneous portion will be executed.
  2. A prompt appears to define the variable, code runs smoothly.
  3. Data flow remains uninterrupted as variable declaration is not necessary.
  4. Data and variable mismatch obstruct the smooth flow of data.
You are testing the response time of your application when it is being used by a significant number of people at a given time. Which of the following will be your choice of testing tool?
A code comprises 100 lines, there are 17 lines of unused codes, and 3 lines of dead code. What would be the statement coverage of such a code?
In the webpage developed by you, the link to register redirects you to the home page. What is most likely the reason for this bug?

A certain application was being subjected to load testing. The application failed to run at the estimated upper limit for the load. How does one proceed at this juncture?

Options

  1. Stress test by applying a greater load than the desired load.
  2. Upward scalability test by increasing load until application collapses.
  3. Downward scalability test by decreasing load in known intervals till application runs.
  4. Soak test by introducing the application in a new environment under the same load.

X adapts the timeboxing software development model for a small project that is time-bound. Which of the following is a probable additional reason for X to choose this model?

Options

  1. Well-defined entry/exit criteria to obtain quality products systematically.
  2. The flexibility to move between phases for modification incorporation.
  3. Each module of the project takes nearly the same time to complete.
  4. The deliverables can be signed off at each phase and are well documented.

A team is developing a web application using the extreme prototype model. Their entire application building has been split into three blocks. What would be their course of action with the first block?

Options

  1. Building a dynamic prototype that the user can interact with.
  2. Building a static prototype mainly consisting of HTML pages. 
  3. Programming the screen of a webpage using simulated service layers.
  4. Decide the incremental units in which the prototype must be designed.

You want to test the functionality of a webpage that you have created for an organization. In what sequence will you carry out the testing procedure?

Options

1. 

1. Verifying the requirement specification
2. Planning and designing the test case
3. Creating a traceability matrix
4. Executing the test case

2.

1. Planning and designing the test case
2. Executing the test case
3. Verifying the requirement specification
4. Creating a traceability matrix

3.

1. Planning and designing the test case
2. Verifying the requirement specification
3. Creating a traceability matrix
4. Executing the test case

4.

1. Creating a traceability matrix
2. Executing the test case
3. Verifying the requirement specification
4. Planning and designing the test case

Two programs A and B which are a part of your project are found to have several unused variables declared within them. The codes have been written in C++. How do you get rid of the extra variables that result in large file size?

Options

  1. Let outputs of A and B be the input for another program K, that uses the rational purify tool to eliminate unused variables.
  2. Let K be a program written to use rational purify, this will be the input to programs A and B; K then eliminates the unused variables.
  3. The rational purify tool is used on A and B to identify the unused variables; the tester then removes the variables manually.
  4. The rational purify tool is used on A and B independently to identify and then eliminate the unused variables.

The software that a team was developing could be split into a set of requirements. While white-box testing these codes, a specific testing program was written for each requirement. At this stage, the user demands modifications to two of the requirements. As a tester, how do you proceed?

Options

  1. You must modify only the source codes of the requirements, the same test codes as earlier can be used.
  2. You must modify the source code for the two requirements and write new test codes for all requirements.
  3. You must modify the source code and then write a new test code for the two requirements.
  4. You must modify the source code and write new test codes for all requirements.

The internal team carrying out the automated testing of a piece of software is provided only with a section of test environments which leads to delay in completion. How can you resolve this issue?

Options

  1. The test environments are to be moved to a cloud to scale test automation.
  2. Pick a licensed test automation tool to scale test automation costs.
  3. A detailed assessment of the application under test helps in scaling the test environment.
  4. The automation test engineers would have strong knowledge about test automation frameworks.

While testing an application a certain bug was identified and dealt with appropriately. The test engineer suspects that this modification might result in another bug elsewhere in the program. What testing technique should the engineer use to retest a modified software?

The website you have developed is being tested to ensure that the links on the website are functional as are the various buttons on the website. What would be your preferred mode of automated testing to achieve this?

The customer organization wishes to deploy its finished application in stages. They indulge in User Acceptance Testing. How is UAT done?

Options

  1. The testing is done in a  controlled environment.
  2. The testing is done first in a controlled and then a real environment.
  3. The testing is done simultaneously in controlled and real environments.
  4. The testing is done in a real business environment.

You are developing an application and the prototype model is the SDLC type of your choice. Upon running the prototype, you decide to make certain modifications to enhance the application. What stage of the modeling does this action redirect you to?
A decision coverage testing is being performed on an if statement. What will be the value of decision coverage?

A developer team is using the hybrid model of VV and prototyping to develop a certain software. Business analysts have completed the initial documentation required. What is the sequence of steps to be taken after this?

Options

1.

1. Prototype testing and customer approval
2. High-level design and testing of prototype
3. Low-level design and testing of prototype
4. Whitebox testing

2.

1. Whitebox testing
2. Prototype testing and customer approval
3. Low-level design and testing of prototype
4. High-level design and testing of prototype

3.

1. Low-level design and testing of prototype
2. Whitebox testing
3. High-level design and testing of prototype
4. Prototype testing and customer approval

4.

1. High-level design and testing of prototype
2. Low-level design and testing of prototype
3. Prototype testing and customer approval
4. Whitebox testing

The application you are developing involves a new software that you and your team of developers have little experience with. The customer is also new to the process of developing an application. With the minimum available information, your team decides that a hybrid model would best suit this process. What hybrid would you select based on available information?

  1. RAD and Agile
  2. VV and Big Bang
  3. Spiral & Prototype
  4. Waterfall and V

You are creating an application X, that can be developed through a set of modules x1, x2, x3, and so on. Upon interacting with the prototype, the user decides to make a few changes in the UI corresponding to module x7. The SDLC method is Spiral. What is the nature of this change, how do you deal with this?

Options

  1. Top-down Incremental Integration Testing
  2. Bottom-up Incremental Integration Testing
  3. Top-down Incremental Non-integration Testing
  4. Bottom-up Incremental Non-integration Testing
While designing a new software proof of concept for the decided design has been developed. In what stage of a spiral SDLC model will this occur?

The software for a mobile application that you are building is one that can be modularised based on utility. Which of the following is a benefit of developing such software?

  1. Each module can be implemented in a specific sequence to ensure functionality.
  2. Different teams can work on different modules and modify them simultaneously.
  3. The mobile application can accommodate constantly changing specifications.
  4. Documentation is unnecessary for mobile applications which simplifies the development process.

A certain report prepared by your team member contains the following:

  • Control Objective ID
  • Control Objective Name
  • Control Activity ID
  • Control Activity Name

What report was your team member preparing?

Options

1.

Issue Assessment and Activity report

2.

Milestone Status report

3.

Audit Objectives and Status report

4.

Issue Identification and Resolution report

In the project closure phase, X is a Waterfall form that allows the storage of important application design, infrastructure, and security data.
What is X?

Options

1.

Certificate of
Compliance and
Acceptance of
Deliverable

2.

Developer Knowledge
Transfer Report

3.

Request for Enhancement

4.

Global Application Support Summary

You are developing software for the supply chain management. Your choice of SDLC method is Waterfall. A co-worker decides to switch to the Agile methodology. Why is this switch a mistake?

Options

1.

Delivering the application in parts renders it useless as the application must have a 100% functionality to be approved.

2.

All necessary and required tasks will be run and tested simultaneously, delaying the product delivery time.

3.

The lack of thorough testing will lead to the production of products with lowered levels of quality.

4.

The initial designs and features might be unnecessary at the time of project completion which will be considered a monetary loss.

During the testing phase of your project, the client requests a preview to the final product. You are unable to fulfil the request. What SDLC model did your organization adapt, that led to this situation?

X is seen interacting with the end-user of software during the implementation of a project that was designed by them. They also respond to all the quality-related issues that stem from the software. What role does X fulfill?

You are a programmer who has developed new software as per the design protocols. The software is now being tested to ensure its proper integration with other systems. Who among the following is best suited to carry out the testing?
X builds a dummy of their upcoming project as a text file with details and visuals on how to build and run the software. What kind of a dummy did X build?

The latest version of running software that was recently launched has reported several errors. What is the best way to deal with the problem?

Options

1. Release guideline documentation to assist users.

2. Provide a monetary refund to the users.

3. Withdraw the software and resolve issues.

4. Revert to a previously functional version and test.
You have just completed the creation of the business case document of your new product. What stage of the software development cycle is your team at?

You are developing software to map the spread of an epidemic and want to list the nearest healthcare centers and help facilities. The structure and type of assistance required are constantly changing, leading to continuous changes in your software design.
What is the ideal SDLC model you must adapt to?
